official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to identify the
		  persons who are eligible to request headstones or markers furnished by the
		  Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and or other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Honor Those Who Served Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Persons eligible
			 to request headstones or markers furnished by the Secretary of Veterans
			 Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 subsections:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 2306 of title
			 38, United States Code

text.#text:
A person may request a headstone or marker
				to commemorate a decedent under this section if the person is—

a personal
				representative authorized in writing by the decedent to make such request;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may be
				identified, a State veterans service agency, a military researcher, a local
				historian, or a genealogist or other person familiar with the research sources
				and methods necessary to prove the identity of the decedent; or

text.#text:
in the case of a
				decedent for whom no person described in

in the case of a
				decedent who is a veteran who served on active duty in the Armed Forces at
				least 62 years before the date on which the headstone or marker is requested,
				any person.

In the case of a
				request for a headstone or marker under this section for a decedent for whom
				insufficient information exists regarding the religious beliefs of the
				individual to select an appropriate emblem of belief for the headstone or
				marker of the decedent, the person requesting the headstone or marker may
				request a headstone or marker without an emblem of
				belief.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply with
			 respect to a request for a headstone or marker submitted after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
